prompt: <description>Part 1 Construct a rectangular prism. Begin by creating a new coordinate system at the origin with zero rotation and translation. Create a face for the first sketch. On this face, create a loop. In this loop, create four lines: 1. Line 1: Starting from (0, 0), ending at (0.5, 0) 2. Line 2: Starting from (0.5, 0), ending at (0.5, 0.75) 3. Line 3: Starting from (0.5, 0.75), ending at (0, 0.75) 4. Line 4: Starting from (0, 0.75), ending at (0, 0) Confirm that this loop is closed. Next, set the scaling factor to 0.75 and extrude the shape to a depth of 0.3 units in the normal direction as the first body feature, effectively making a 3D shape. Part 2 Create a new coordinate system at (0, 0, 0.3) with zero rotation and translation. Create a face for the second sketch. On this face, create a loop. In this loop, create four lines: 1. Line 1: Starting from (0, 0), ending at (0.15, 0) 2. Line 2: Starting from (0.15, 0), ending at (0.15, 0.75) 3. Line 3: Starting from (0.15, 0.75), ending at (0, 0.75) 4. Line 4: Starting from (0, 0.75), ending at (0, 0) Confirm that this loop is closed. Next, set the scaling factor to 0.75 and extrude the shape to a depth of 0.15 units in the opposite normal direction as the second body feature, effectively making a cut in the first body. Part 3 Create a new coordinate system at (0.225, 0.275, 0.3) with zero rotation and translation. Create a face for the third sketch. On this face, create a loop. In this loop, create a circle at the center of the coordinate system with a radius of 0.1 units. Confirm that this loop is closed. Next, set the scaling factor to 0.2 and extrude the shape to a depth of 1.25 units in the opposite normal direction as the third body feature, effectively making a hole in the second body.</description>
